result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:54 PM Defendant Marvin Joseph Roelke in court.  Attorney Gibson D Hatch in court for Marvin Joseph Roelke.  Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross in court for the State of Wisconsin. Right to preliminary hearing recited to defendant. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Attorney Hatch requested arraignment in Br. 1.
Arraignment scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plaintiffs Motion and Demand for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by ADA Jonathan Ross
Copy of discovery letter to Attorney Hatch from ADA Jonathan Ross

Defendant was in custody in Dane County jail, did not have a ride for today, can appear next week. State not requesting warrant. 3:08 PM
Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Order to Produce Defendant 10-26-22 from Dane County Jail
Preliminary hearing on October 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
